intro: Tetragastris, commonly known as the four-lobed fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of a few species, primarily found in tropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. They produce fig-like fruits that are typically edible and serve as a food source for various animals. Tetragastris species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
